title: Ticket #2038: Long file paths corrupt memory in file locking code
description:
If the FileLock class is given a file with path longer than 255 characters, it will corrupt memory, leading to a crash. FileLock::CreateHashName() creates a buffer of size _POSIX_PATH_MAX and passes it to the libc function realpath(). realpath() is expecting a buffer of size PATH_MAX. On our platforms, _POSIX_PATH_MAX is 256 with PATH_MAX is 1024 or 4096.

We saw this crash the schedd on submit.chtc.wisc.edu when jobs were submitted with a user log path of 256 characters.

We should review any other code that uses _POSIX_PATH_MAX.

Pushed commit to V7_6-branch for 7.6.0. FileLock::CreateHashName() now uses PATH_MAX.

2011-Apr-27 13:07:52 by danb:
Contrary to the previous "fixed version" in this ticket, the patch did not get released in 7.6.0. It is on V7_6-branch and will therefore be released in 7.6.1.

2011-Apr-27 13:12:16 by danb:
Suggested workaround for this problem: 

   CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK = false

I originally recommended the following alternative workaround, but it DOES NOT WORK! See #2116 for why. 

   ENABLE_USERLOG_LOCKING = false
